thread.title: State Fire Marshal's Office report shows Panhandle-Plains Historical Museum violations
thread.title_full: State Fire Marshal's Office report shows Panhandle-Plains Historical Museum violations

author: @NewsChannel10
title: State Fire Marshal's Office report shows Panhandle-Plains Historical Museum violations
text:
Report shows Panhandle-Plains Historical Museum fire and safety violations
AMARILLO, Texas (KFDA) - Since the announcement of the Panhandle-Plains Historical Museum closing on March 24, we have obtained the report that led to that closure.
The 52 page report outlines the violations that the State Fire Marshalâ€™s Office found during the January inspection.
Some of the issues range from minor infractions to others that could be considered more severe.
Exposed wiring was located in numerous areas throughout the building. Some light fixtures were found hanging by the wires.
The ceiling in the IT room was found to be damaged with more exposed wiring.
Investigators found an electrical panel with circuit breakers tied together using copper wire.
They also report excessive amounts of combustibles stored throughout the structure.
Some safety concerns were also noted, stating the excessive length it would take visitors to reach an exit during an emergency.
